function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Use of sqlite database to store covid-19 data","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Performance evaluation and testing process","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Using web scraping to retrieve covid-19 data from external sources can lead to inaccurate or outdated information.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependence on a single website for covid-19 data retrieval increases the risk of system failure if the website is down or inaccessible.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential security risks when scraping data from external websites, including exposure to malicious code or unauthorized access to sensitive data.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Relying solely on web scraping for covid-19 data may result in incomplete or inaccurate information, increasing the risk of incorrect diagnosis and decision-making.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependence on an expert system for early detection of covid-19 may lead to misdiagnosis and delayed treatment, increasing the risk of disease transmission within the community.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of human expert oversight in the decision-making process based on the expert system’s recommendations may lead to errors and adverse consequences in covid-19 management.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Implementation of a website-based expert system for covid-19 diagnosis","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Diagnosis of covid-19 using ct image features","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Mobile application for covid-19 symptom diagnosis","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on web scraping for covid-19 information","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Deployment of mobile applications for covid-19 risk detection","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Recommend building measures not implemented correctly","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of focus on airborne transmission reduction in hospitals and public buildings","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation leading to airborne transmission of sars-cov-2 virus","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ineffectiveness of engineering controls in reducing airborne infection risks","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate maintenance of air cleaners leading to reduced filtration efficiency","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of person-to-person transmission in indoor environments","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of clear guidelines for safe occupancy numbers in indoor spaces","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Risk of airborne transmission in public transportation systems","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential ineffectiveness of upper-room guv in killing or inactivating airborne microorganisms due to inadequate uv fluence rate or non-uniform uvgi distribution","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Variation in performance of portable consumer air cleaning devices depending on design and room size","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential ineffectiveness of guv ’in-duct’ application in disinfecting contaminated extracts or ventilation ducts","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased humidity can decrease the inactivation of bacterial and viral aerosols, potentially leading to higher transmission of contagious diseases.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of data on the effectiveness of uv-c inactivating sars-cov-2, which may lead to uncertainty in the selection of appropriate control measures for the virus.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential reliance on upper-room germicidal uv guv systems as the primary control measure, leading to neglect of other essential infection control strategies.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Recirculation of air in the built environment during an epidemic, including covid-19, can lead to the dissemination of virus-laden particles.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Air cleaning and disinfection devices may be beneficial in environments with poor ventilation.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Airborne transmission of infectious viruses due to air recirculation in public buildings","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ineffectiveness of filters in removing small particles associated with adverse health effects","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Modification of hvac control strategies may not be straightforward and could lead to unintended consequences for temperature, humidity, and air flow distribution.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Customization of ventilation systems can introduce new design vulnerabilities and potential failure points, increasing the risk of airborne disease transmission.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependence on natural ventilation methods may result in inconsistent and unreliable outdoor air flow rates, leading to varying levels of ventilation effectiveness.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation in public buildings and shared spaces","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Survival of airborne pathogens in indoor environments","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Returning to inadequately ventilated workplaces and public buildings","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Local barriers to ventilation due to partitions or drawn curtains","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limitations in increasing ventilation rates during the covid-19 pandemic","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation leading to high concentration of virus-laden air","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of recognition of ventilation as a critical method for reducing airborne transmission","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate distribution of ventilation leading to inadequate dilution of contaminated air","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient emphasis on protection from small, virus-laden, airborne droplets by international health organizations like the who, rehva, and ashrae.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Difficulty in quantitatively comparing and concluding the most significant transmission route for viruses in a given situation.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of recommendations and engineering controls to reduce the potential airborne transmission of sars-cov-2 and other airborne viruses.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Airborne transmission of contagious diseases such as tuberculosis, measles, chickenpox, sars-cov, mers-cov, rsv, and influenza.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Viral loads found in personal samplers worn by the sampling team when in the presence of a patient receiving oxygen via nasal cannula, indicating potential airborne transmission.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of direct confirmatory evidence of self-inoculation into mucous membranes as the end-stage pathway to infection through droplet and contact transmission routes.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Incongruity in the level of evidence required to demonstrate airborne transmission compared to other transmission modes.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential airborne transmission of sars-cov-2","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"}]}
